title: Influence of Drug-Polymer Interactions on Release Kinetics of PLGA and PLA/PET Nanoparticles

authors.name: Carlos Aleman
affiliations: Barcelona Research Center for Multiscale Science and Engineering

summary: The study investigates how drug-polymer interactions affect release kinetics in poly(lactic-co-glycolic acid) (PLGA) and polylactide-co-ethylene glycol (PLA/PEG) nanoparticles, aiming to develop more effective antimicrobial drug delivery systems.
methods: Microfluidic-based synthesis of nano-sized carriers for drug delivery systems (NDDS), precise control over nanocarrier characteristics, encapsulation efficiency improvement.
results: The release kinetics of poly(lactic-co-glycolic acid) (PLGA) and polylactide-co-ethylene glycol copolymers (PLA/PEG) nanoparticles were studied under various conditions to understand their influence on drug-polymer interactions. The study found that both types of nanoparticles exhibited controlled release profiles, but differences in release rates could be attributed to varying degrees of polymer degradation and drug diffusion through the nanoparticle matrix.
funding_sources: European Union’s research and innovation programme under the Marie Skłodowska-Curie grant agreement No 101072645
